definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Dioxins are unwanted byproducts of some industrial processes and waste incineration.
sentences.chinese: 二噁英是一些工業過程和廢物焚化的有害副產品。
有一些在焚化爐內被焚燒。

sentences.english: Incineration of my memory, marking you dwells beauty.
sentences.chinese: 焚化我的記憶，祭奠你猶存的美麗。

sentences.english: We have two incinerators that, uh, burn all the combustibles.
sentences.chinese: 我們有兩個焚化爐，焚化所有的可燃物。

sentences.english: We have two incinerators that, uh, burn all the combustibles.
sentences.chinese: 我們有兩個焚化爐，焚化所有的可燃物。

sentences.english: The bears pulled burning garbage from an incinerator, which caused the fire.
sentences.chinese: 棕熊從焚化爐拉出還在燃燒的垃圾，因而造成火災。

sentences.english: The Pureland Wheel mantra sheet can be offered on the altar or burned to grant blessings.
sentences.chinese: 此淨土咒輪可以供在佛桌上或焚化以施加持。

sentences.english: Nobody wants a dump, or an incinerator, next door.
sentences.chinese: 誰都不願在自己的家門口有個垃圾場或垃圾焚化爐。

sentences.english: Thou hast sacrificed and given my children to them, consecrating them by fire.
sentences.chinese: 你竟祭殺了我的子女，予以焚化，獻給它們。

sentences.english: Incineration cannot , of course , eliminate landfilling .
sentences.chinese: 焚化當然不可能避免掩埋。

sentences.english: Then a giant incinerator in space would burn the garbage.
sentences.chinese: 太空中的那個巨大的焚化爐就會把它們都燒掉。

sentences.english: That leaf was almost certainly torn up and sent to the incinerator .
sentences.chinese: 幾乎可以肯定這一頁後來被撕下來送進了焚化爐。

sentences.english: Family members filled with sorrow sending my Mother-In-Law to Mandai Crematorium.
sentences.chinese: 家庭成員以悲痛的心情送岳母大人到萬里焚化場。

sentences.english: Now some companies don't want to deal with building landfills and incinerators here.
sentences.chinese: 目前有些公司不想在當地建立掩埋場和焚化爐。

sentences.english: This should be done in an incinerator to ensure a hot, complete burning.
sentences.chinese: 應使用焚化爐進行焚燒，以保證高溫和充分的燃燒。

sentences.english: We spoke above about water that combusts .
sentences.chinese: 我們在上文曾提過自我焚化的水。

definition: to burn down/to destroy with fire
joss paper made to resemble paper money
